alert.note: Alert for Anderson; Franklin (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 02 at 8:10PM CDT by NWS Topeka
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Franklin and Anderson Counties through 915 PM CDT... At 810 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Quenemo to 4 miles southwest of Waverly to 3 miles east of Gridley. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Ottawa, Garnett, Wellsville, Pomona, Richmond, Colony, Williamsburg, Greeley, Princeton, Lane, Rantoul, Westphalia, Kincaid, Lone Elm and Harris. This includes Interstate 35 between mile markers 168 and 198. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
